long_summary:
- Views and viewpoints used in software architecture to structure complex descriptions
- Views break down system into aspects; viewpoints provide view templates
- Viewpoints guide view content, representation, issues, solutions
- Academic roots back to Parnas in 1970s, recent work by Perry and Wolf
- Sets of viewpoints developed by Kruchten, RM-ODP, Hofmeister et al.
- Books by Garland & Anthony, Woods et al
- Viewpoints defined for information systems using UML
- Conceptual model relates viewpoints and views to environment
- Basis of ISO Standard, developed from previous IEEE Standard
